intro: Babingtonia granitica, commonly known as the granite babingtonia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody shrub form. The plant features narrow, leathery leaves and produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It is adapted to grow in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Babingtonia granitica is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native habitat.
